meanings.sent1: She limbers up before her dance class by stretching her arms and legs.
meanings.sent2: He limbers his muscles before the race to avoid injuries.
meanings.sent3: The cat limbers up its body before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine limbers up slowly before roaring to life.
meanings.sent5: Limbering up before exercise helps prevent muscle strains.

meanings.definition: A two-wheeled horse-drawn vehicle used for hauling loads
meanings.sent1: The farmer loaded the hay onto the limbers for transport.
meanings.sent2: The limbers creaked as they carried heavy logs down the road.
meanings.sent3: The limbers rolled smoothly along the dirt path, carrying the harvest.
meanings.sent4: The limbers stood idle in the barn until needed for the next delivery.
meanings.sent5: The limbers rattled as they moved, announcing their arrival.

meanings.definition: A person who limbers up, especially before physical activity
meanings.sent1: The limbers led the group in warm-up exercises before the game.
meanings.sent2: As a limbers, she always arrives early to stretch and prepare for practice.
meanings.sent3: The limbers joked with the team while helping them stretch before the match.
meanings.sent4: Being a limbers requires dedication to staying flexible and ready.
meanings.sent5: The limbers' positive energy motivates the team to perform their best.
